examples: The business consultant recommended that we expand our operations overseas, but when we faced unexpected challenges and losses, he was not held accountable, highlighting the reality that advisors run no risks.
Then you're being accountable.
But we are still accountable, for our own recovery.
The power shift is so strongly now toward Facebook, they are not really accountable.
A sudden death and no one to hold accountable.
words.defineEn: responsible for one's actions and being ready to explain them
words.defineVi: chịu trách nhiệm về hành động của một người và sẵn sàng giải thích chúng

examples: So these things right over here are somewhat arbitrary.
So the deficit is not kind of arbitrary.
They're just as arbitrary.
Because we've all agreed on a shared mental dictionary, the actual sounds themselves can be arbitrary.

words.defineEn: not based on reason but on chance or personal impulse, which is often unfair
words.defineVi: không dựa trên lý trí mà dựa trên cơ hội hoặc sự bốc đồng cá nhân, điều này thường không công bằng

examples: The team had been preparing for the big game for months, and when they stepped onto the field, they went to town, scoring goal after goal and securing a decisive victory.
That's very decisive.

With the North’s decisive victory, Confederate dollars were suddenly useless scraps of paper.
It erupted after one decisive meeting.
words.defineEn: able to make decisions quickly and confidently
words.defineVi: có thể đưa ra quyết định một cách nhanh chóng và tự tin

examples: Podcasters are eligible.

New York I was eligible.
words.defineEn: possessing the right to do or have something because of having the required qualifications
words.defineVi: sở hữu quyền để làm hoặc có một cái gì đó vì có trình độ cần thiết

examples: The landlord did not seem inclined to trust me with lodging before seeing the color of my money.
They are inclined to bite on the back of your leg.
But they’re very inclined to agree.
But they’re very inclined to agree.
Customers are inclined to shop at stores with familiar names, and more shoppers mean more sales.
words.defineEn: having a tendency to do something; possessing an innate ability for something
words.defineVi: có xu hướng làm điều gì đó; sở hữu một khả năng bẩm sinh cho một cái gì đó

examples: The indecisive job applicant was afraid to apply for his dream job, imagining all the ways he could be rejected.
But he's just indecisive.
Also depression can make you feel indecisive.
First, Putin perceives us as weak, feckless, indecisive, slow to respond.
Two, I'm so indecisive that I'm scared I would get a tattoo and instantly hate it.
words.defineEn: (of a person) having difficulty making choices or decisions, often due to fear, lack of confidence, or overthinking
words.defineVi: (của một người) gặp khó khăn trong việc lựa chọn hoặc quyết định, thường là do sợ hãi, thiếu tự tin hoặc suy nghĩ quá nhiều

examples: This person is extremely inflexible in his thinking.

And number four: Is overconscientious scrupulous, and inflexible about matters of morality, ethics, or values.
words.defineEn: reluctant to compromise or change one's attitude, belief, plan, etc.
words.defineVi: miễn cưỡng thỏa hiệp hoặc thay đổi thái độ, niềm tin, kế hoạch, v.v.

examples: False positives in medical testing are preferable to false negatives, but they can still lead to stress or unnecessary treatment.
Maybe that's preferable to the idea that humans just take pleasure in the activity of fighting and pursue it merely for its own sake.
We have not been having great weather here in Montana - but it’s preferable to that.
While an agreement is preferable, we are prepared to leave if we can't find compromises.
So, buying organic is still preferable, but does not grant you moral absolution.
words.defineEn: more desirable or favored compared to other options
words.defineVi: mong muốn hơn hoặc được ưa chuộng hơn so với các lựa chọn khác

examples: The timing of President Trump's Senate impeachment trial remains undecided.
It's still undecided.
Now he's undecided.
And there were no undecideds.

words.defineEn: not yet made a decision or come to a judgment
words.defineVi: chưa đưa ra quyết định hoặc đi đến phán quyết

examples: Pop is a feast to the ears of many, but I despise it.

Others despise it.
And lastly, I despise cold weather.
He just despises you now, yeah.
words.defineEn: to hate and have no respect for something or someone
words.defineVi: để ghét và không có sự tôn trọng cho một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó

examples: Find a hobby.
After all, love will find a way.
Water will always find its own level.

The court found in her favor.
words.defineEn: (of a law court) to make an official decision
words.defineVi: (của tòa án) đưa ra quyết định chính thức

examples: An industry-backed initiative petition with a large marketing budget overturned the apple cart.

words.defineEn: to reverse, abolish, or invalidate something, especially a legal decision
words.defineVi: để đảo ngược, bãi bỏ, hoặc làm mất hiệu lực một cái gì đó, đặc biệt là một quyết định pháp lý

examples: Pass the salt, please.

Close the door, please.

Please write your name on the paper.
words.defineEn: to do or behave as one desires
words.defineVi: để làm hoặc cư xử như một mong muốn

examples: Remember, never put off until tomorrow what you can do today!

There's no point in putting off what can be done today until tomorrow.
One shall never put off what one can do today till tomorrow.
Jamie always tends to put off today's work till tomorrow, but that ends tonight.
words.defineEn: to cause a person to dislike someone or something
words.defineVi: để gây ra một người không thích một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: This reversed Euclid’s idea.
Three taps is reverse.

So you did the reverse.
words.defineEn: to change something such as a process, situation, etc. to be the opposite of what it was before
words.defineVi: để thay đổi một cái gì đó chẳng hạn như một quá trình, tình huống, vv để ngược lại với những gì trước đây

examples: The house rules are crystal clear.

The new rules should help cut the red tape for farmers.
words.defineEn: to make an official decision about something
words.defineVi: để đưa ra một quyết định chính thức về một cái gì đó

words.defineEn: to undertake an action even though one might fail
words.defineVi: để thực hiện một hành động mặc dù một người có thể thất bại

words.defineEn: to think about something very carefully before doing it
words.defineVi: để suy nghĩ về một cái gì đó rất cẩn thận trước khi làm nó

examples: The coach told his players, a rotten apple injures its neighbors, so I expect each of you to uphold the values of good sportsmanship and teamwork.
The respected judge did not involve himself in minor legal disputes, as the saying goes, eagles never catch flies, but instead focused on upholding the law and maintaining justice.

The editor-in-chief instructed her reporters to uphold journalistic ethics and avoid using language that could be seen as defamatory or discriminatory, reminding them of the proverb a goose quill is more dangerous than a lion's claw.
United Nations judges in The Hague upheld a genocide conviction against former Bosnian Serb military chief Ratko Mladic.
My contribution to music has been upholding the beautiful rhythms and melodies from Africa.
words.defineEn: (particularly of a law court) to state that a previous decision is correct
words.defineVi: (đặc biệt là của một tòa án luật) để tuyên bố rằng một quyết định trước đó là chính xác

examples: She won the admiration of many people in her battle against cancer.

John witnessed how a known scam artist was treated with respect and admiration once he had made a fortune through his shady dealings.
She had always admired the celebrity from afar, but after meeting them in person, she realized that admiration is the daughter of ignorance - she had not known the person behind the public persona.
words.defineEn: a feeling of much respect for and approval of someone or something
words.defineVi: một cảm giác rất tôn trọng và chấp thuận của một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: Adoption of this new system wasn't easy.

That proposal will be refined before possible adoption at the expanded G20 meeting next month in Italy.
words.defineEn: the action of starting to use a certain plan, name, method, or idea
words.defineVi: hành động bắt đầu sử dụng một kế hoạch, tên, phương pháp hoặc ý tưởng nhất định

examples: The young actress received an award for her outstanding performance.

The Purple Heart, our nation's oldest military medal, is awarded to those service men and women who have borne the battle, sacrificing life and limb.
words.defineEn: an official decision based on which something is given to someone
words.defineVi: một quyết định chính thức dựa trên đó một cái gì đó được trao cho một ai đó

examples: "Saving money can be difficult, but little drops make the ocean, and small savings can add up over time," said the financial advisor during the consultation.

words.defineVi: hành động hoặc quá trình thảo luận điều gì đó với một người hoặc một nhóm người

examples: And that led to a conundrum.

words.defineEn: a problem or question that is confusing and needs a lot of skill or effort to solve or answer
words.defineVi: một vấn đề hoặc câu hỏi khó hiểu và cần rất nhiều kỹ năng hoặc nỗ lực để giải quyết hoặc trả lời

examples: After numerous inspections, the correct answer to this dilemma still remains at sea.

words.defineVi: một tình huống khó khăn vì phải lựa chọn giữa hai hoặc nhiều lựa chọn có tầm quan trọng như nhau

examples: That's appellate jurisdiction.

words.defineEn: the power or authority of a court of law or an organization to make legal decisions and judgements

examples: Rivalries and prejudice were by degrees fading out.

words.defineVi: một ý kiến hoặc đánh giá vô lý dựa trên cảm giác không thích đối với một người, một nhóm, v.v., đặc biệt là vì chủng tộc, giới tính của họ, v.v.

examples: Resistance will always remain a thorn in the flesh of Zionism and its ideology which is rooted in the perverse notion of supremacy and power.

words.defineVi: một quyết định được đưa ra bởi một người có quyền lực chính thức, đặc biệt là một thẩm phán

words.defineEn: to think about something before making a decision
words.defineVi: để suy nghĩ về một cái gì đó trước khi đưa ra quyết định

words.defineVi: để suy nghĩ về một thực tế nhất định trước khi đưa ra quyết định
